intro: Digitaria herpoclados, commonly known as the hairy fingergrass, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that contain both male and female flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and agricultural areas. Digitaria herpoclados is a common weed in many parts of the world and is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions.
